CUSTOM INDUSTRIAL PACKAGING SOLUTIONS
FOR COMPLEX PACKAGING CHALLENGES

OrCon Industries custom packaging manufacturers engineers custom packaging solutions and industrial packaging for companies that need to transport complex and fragile products.

EXPLORE ENGINEERED PACKAGING SOLUTIONSREQUEST CUSTOM PACKAGING QUOTE
40 YEARS OF INDUSTRY-LEADING INNOVATION

We help companies thrive by developing comprehensive solutions for the most demanding packaging challenges in their industry.

With unparalleled access to sources of the highest-quality packaging materials, as well as a team of advance-degree engineers, OrCon custom packaging manufacturers utilize world-class technologies to design, test, and engineer containers that protect fragile products and materials.

Organizations continue to choose our services as custom packaging manufacturers because of the way we collaborate with their leaders to determine a strategy that works with their application, budget, and timeline.

In 2024, our mission is to continue to provide industry-leading packaging solutions to companies that rely on us to protect their valuable assets. Now more than ever, companies need scalable strategies that prioritize sustainability, and we’re poised to take on the challenges.

TACKLE YOUR CHALLENGES WITH ORCON
Engineered Packaging Solutions
OrCon Industries is a Certified ISTA Lab

The best packaging solutions start with a thorough understanding of your product and how it will be shipped and handled. We’re at our best when we discuss these requirements with you, share CAD designs, and assess the options, because it allows our custom packaging manufacturers to craft a fully-customized container that’s nothing less than perfect for your product.

EXPLORE ENGINEERED PACKAGING SOLUTIONS
How to Choose the Right Custom Industrial Packaging Solution

Choosing the right custom industrial packaging solution is critical to protect your goods during shipping and storage. There are many factors to consider when it comes to the items you’re packaging, the lifespan of the packaging itself, and your item’s end-user, and oftentimes, the most cost-effective and protective packaging solution will combine multiple packaging materials for a custom solution from a custom packaging manufacturer.

LEARN HOW TO CHOOSE INDUSTRIAL PACKAGING
Packaging Products and Materials

Diving deep into the requirements of your application enables our custom packaging manufacturers to find the best-fit material for your package. We have long-standing relationships with material manufacturers and distributors so you can package your items with the right material, for the best price in the shortest amount of time.

You have access to dozens of products and materials. Here are a few that we specialize in:

foam products such as polyurethane, polyethylene, polystyrene and polypropylene
wood crates and custom pallets
light duty and heavy duty hard plastic cases for electronic items, A/V equipment, and general purposes
specialty rack systems for in-house material handling
paper, foam, and air void fillers
EXPLORE THE FULL PRODUCT LINE
Custom Branded Industrial Packaging

There are many benefits to custom branded industrial packaging. By having your company name and logo printed on the packaging, you can ensure that your products will stand out from the competition. This can help to build brand awareness and increase sales. In addition, custom branding can also help to improve customer satisfaction by making it easier for them to identify your products. And because industrial packaging is often used for shipping and storage, it can also help to protect your products from damage. As a result, custom packaging design from custom packaging manufacturers can be a valuable asset for any business.

GET A QUOTE FOR CUSTOM PACKAGING

Our facility in LeRoy, NY contains more than meets the eye. We offer a number of in-house services to our customers to deliver the highest-quality product and industrial packaging at the best possible price.

These include:

Econoco directly serves the entire retail industry – from department stores, specialty stores, mass merchandisers and discounters to store planners, architects, design consultants and more than 600 store fixture and retail packaging distributors.

We offer an ever expanding in-stock product catalog that includes acrylic and glass displays, point of purchase counter displays, grid panels and grid accessories, garment racks, wall displays and display standards, shelving and merchandising units, showcases and counters, slatwall merchandisers and accessories, sign holders, back room supplies, display tables, bespoke retail fixture systems, mannequins and forms.

To complement every great retail display, Econoco’s subsidiary Mondo Mannequins serve the nation’s leading retailers and brands with mannequins, forms and visual displays in exciting finishes and textures that highlight the merchandise and strike an emotional chord with consumers. The result is an increase in sales for the retailer.

In today’s ever changing world, we have created the opportunity for the independent retail store as well as the general public to purchase direct from us, the manufacturer. Our industrial quality store fixtures are offered at such a great value that many people are finding a use of our products within the home.

Econoco’s near century of leadership continues to bring more options and value. Each of our divisions is strategically designed to maximize your brand and its impact at point of sale.

CRESCENT BRANDS: CUSTOM FRAMING SOLUTIONS

For over 120 years, Crescent Brands has been at the forefront of innovation for wholesale matboard and framing manufacturing, creating some of the most renowned products on the market. Everything we create is crafted with the utmost attention to detail and designed with framers and artists in mind.

For five generations, the Ozmun family has poured their hearts and souls into revolutionizing the custom framing industry. This foundation of leadership and commitment has allowed Crescent Cardboard to serve thousands of artists and custom framers across six continents.

2021

CRESCENT ACQUIRES U.S. OPERATIONS OF NIELSEN BAINBRIDGE

Crescent Cardboard Company is pleased to announce it has acquired the U.S. businesses of Nielsen Bainbridge, a leading producer of products for framing professionals and conservators. Nielsen Bainbridge has combined advanced scientific research and innovative design to deliver groundbreaking products used by custom framers and museums worldwide. We feel this acquisition will enhance Crescent’s worldwide leadership in the manufacturing and marketing of high-quality paper and board products for artists, custom framers and institutions worldwide.

CRESCENT CARDBOARD COMPANY REBRANDS AS CRESCENT BRANDS

In a subsequent move, Crescent Cardboard Company will be rebranding as Crescent Brands. Crescent Brands will operate as a portfolio company that will utilize its resources to manufacture, supply, promote and support brands such as Crescent, Bainbridge, Artcare, Nielsen, Nurre Caxton, Valiani, and more. We are making this change due to our respect and admiration for the Nielsen, Bainbridge and Nurre Caxton brands. We intend to operate these brands independently to keep continuity in the products many have come to know and love. More information to follow as we make this transition.

OVER 100 YEARS OF RECYCLING EXPERIENCE

Northstar Pulp & Paper is a full service recycling and trash hauling company with a century’s worth of experience in assisting businesses to reduce their waste stream and develop innovative recycling programs.  Our business, based in Springfield, Massachusetts, prides itself in being the only recycling company in New England that has the ability to fully process and market every grade of paper, plastic, and metal.

Our recycling professionals have an intimate knowledge of the commodity business that can only be achieved through decades of hands-on experience.  This expertise allows us to develop efficient, turn-key recycling programs that are specifically designed to complement our supplier’s existing manufacturing operation.

Admiral Packaging, Inc. manufactures and delivers high quality flexible packaging through best-in-class technology, skilled employees, and commitment to service.
Admiral Packaging, Inc. Promotes Arron Carroll to President

We are proud to announce the promotion of Arron Carroll to President. Arron has served Admiral Packaging for seven years, most recently as Executive Vice President, where his leadership has been critical to the company’s success and operational growth.  “Arron’s vision and leadership have been central to Admiral Packaging’s ongoing growth and success. Arron has championed process improvement as we continue to add more value and provide sustainable products for our customers. I am very excited for the next chapter ” said Harley Frank, CEO of Admiral Packaging. “I am thrilled to elevate Arron to President. ”  Under Arron’s leadership, Admiral will continue to provide exceptional service and top-quality packaging solutions to its valued customers.

Press Release
Admiral Packaging Installs a New Coater Laminator

We are proud to announce the installation and commissioning of a new coater laminator.  This investment marks Admiral’s fifth consecutive year of major capital projects to support growth and provide the latest technology in printing and converting for flexible packaging.  The new coater laminator expands lamination capacity and introduces new coating capabilities such as functional coatings, varnishes, and other specialty coatings.  The addition of a second laminator strengthens Admiral’s ability to support customers with unexpected demand or surges as well as new product launches.

Our Capabilities Press Release
Admiral Packaging Achieves Accreditation under the Esko XPS Crystal Certification Program

The certification program ensures that best-in-class plate making processes are being followed including predictable and accurate plate relief, highest plate making consistency, and overall high plate quality.  In line with Admiral’s LEAN manufacturing initiatives, the XPS Crystal exposing unit offers a perfect, consolidated flexo platemaking workflow and excels in efficiency by reducing manual steps, errors, and operator time.  With synchronized main and back UV LED exposure, the XPS Crystal provides repeatable, consistent flexo plate quality.

Our Capabilities Press Release
Admiral Packaging, Inc. offers Life Cycle Analysis (LCA) Studies as part of Admiral GreenVantage

As part of Admiral’s GreenVantage, an LCA study is designed to quantify the environmental impact of sustainable packaging solutions and provide a holistic, comprehensive, and customizable report.  The study allows a comparison of a variety of packaging solutions side-by-side to help brand owners select the best option to meet their sustainability goals.

Life Cycle Analysis Press Release
Admiral Packaging, Inc. reveals NEW Metallic Advantage

Metallic Advantage is a NEW proprietary de-metalizing process developed at Admiral Packaging that allows our partners to produce packaging with visually stunning metallic effects, while allowing for full transparent windows to view the product content inside of their packaging.

Metallic Advantage Press Release
Announcement: Admiral Packaging, Inc launches Sustainable Packaging Initiative – Admiral GreenVantage

Admiral Packaging, Inc is proud to launch Admiral GreenVantage, a series of products and services designed to provide holistic and impactful  sustainable packaging solutions to its clients. Using an innovative and quantitative approach, Admiral Packaging is helping brand owners define and meet their sustainability goals.

GreenVantage Press Release

From Custom Boxes to Custom Envelopes we have everything you need to create your Custom Packaging Solution!

Our Packaging Solutions include ecommerce packaging, custom boxes, labels and custom envelopes. As a top envelope supplier and packaging company in North America, our team will work with you to create a custom packaging solution that meets all your needs and provide an outstanding representation of your brand. Your packaging solutions should cater to your business; we develop custom boxes and custom envelopes using innovative ideas to deliver your branding message. We collaborate with customers from a wide variety of industries including pharmaceutical, health & beauty, ecommerce, nutraceutical, food & beverage, apparel, electronics and many more!

Your packaging is the vehicle that delivers your products to your customers – it needs to be the best representation of your brand as possible and to create amazing un-boxing experiences.

Custom Packaging Solutions are our forte and our exceptional team will ensure your solution(s) exceed all your expectations. By combining custom boxes and custom envelopes into your packaging solution, your consistent messaging will enhance your audience interaction. Our custom envelope customers include fine paper merchants, independent envelope printers, stationery suppliers, solution providers (such as forms manufacturers and large printers), statement preparation providers, as well as end-users and organizations who use direct mail. Our custom packaging is ideal for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, food, health & beauty, ecommerce organizations and those who are brand and environmentally conscious.

CRESPAC, INC.

Closing the Loop on Plastics Recycling

 

PRODUCT CATEGORIES

All of Our Products are 100% Manufactured in the U. S. A.

MUSHROOM TILLS

PAINT SUNDRIES

MEAT & PRODUCE TRAYS

Crespac offers the the widest range of fresh mushroom tills in the industry.  We carry significant stock of all major sizes in a variety of colors and consistently ship to sites all over North America.  All of our mushroom tills are manufactured in an SQF certified environment using a minimum of 80% post-consumer recycled content resin.

We are a leading manufacturer of thermoformed paint sundries.  All of our paint products are produced using 100% recycled PETE resin – an environmentally friendly plastic alternative that is also durable and solvent resistant.  We specialize in partnering with industry leading brands to develop value-added, high turnover items that promote success at the nation’s largest home improvement and paint retailers.

Our large family of recycled content PETE meat and produce overwrap trays provide a cost-effective, high-performance, and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional foam trays.  All of our market trays are manufactured using a minimum of 80% post-consumer recycled resin in an SQF certified production environment.

WHO WE ARE
The Kelly Box Family

We've been making boxes since 1955. Since then, we've discovered it's not just about the box, but the product within it, and the people behind it. That's why we've established a team of experts within Kelly Box: so we can create the perfect box for our customer and their product. 

It starts with our design and engineering department, which has an Amazon-Certified testing lab and a team of engineers to help with custom designs and relevant cushioning to protect product in transit. If graphic design work is needed, we're covered there too with a talented design team to help with customer branding and perfecting your branding.

Our team of customer service and sales representatives have dedicated accounts to help every step of the way and utilize the latest technologies and programming alongside our manufacturing and logistics departments to have a real-time knowledge of where your packaging is in every step of the process. 

In our 5 facilities, we utilize the latest in packaging manufacturing technology and machines that enable us to custom engineer and produce a diverse sizing of packaging - from the smallest detail in print and edging, to large sizes and large quantities.

Experts in The Field of Digital Printing

Driven by our commitment to excellence, in 2015 we acquired the largest and fastest six-color UV digital printer in the United States. The Barberán Jetmaster 1890, a direct-to-substrate printer from digital file – meaning no plates – is a six-color printer – CMYK + orange and violet, chosen specifically to extend the Pantone color gamut – can print up to 70,000 sq ft per hour. It’s a single pass, large-format, production speed digital printer that produces stunning litho-like quality images at 360 dpi. This cutting-edge technology, together with our expert team of digital professionals, not only simplifies the design process, but provides our customers with the highest quality product on the market.

The acquisition of our Barberán Jetmaster 1890 and the great pride we feel in being able to bring our customers the fastest, most efficient, and richest print quality in the Northeast is why we have fondly named our Jetmaster “The Beast From The East”.  The response has been so positive that since January of 2017, we have converted 99% of our litho clients to this award-winning technology. 

“When we need an innovative design solution, Abbott-Action’s designers always meet the challenge head on and come up with a design that exceeds our expectations. Their service and quality are top notch, and we would highly recommend them to anyone who is in search of a supplier of custom packaging or corrugated displays.”
— William A., Display Purchasing
Our Commitment to Sustainability and the Future of Our Planet.

When Abbott-Action Packaging relocated its manufacturing facility in 2013 from Canton, Massachusetts to Attleboro, Massachusetts – a facility built in the late 1960’s – we understood renovations would be necessary. However, from planning through production, we were insistent that a keen focus be kept on sustainability. In a short time, we have made enormous strides in reducing our carbon footprint and eliminating a significant number of greenhouse gasses. The figures below represent just a small part of the impact we have made with our sustainability initiatives.

PREGPREG PRODUCTS

Aerospace, Industrial, Composite Overwrapped Pressure Vessels (COPV), Medical, Sporting Goods, and Automotive Markets

LEARN MORE
Aerospace

Born from the Space industry, TCR Composites prepreg materials continue to play a critical role in commercial and military rocket motor applications, with new material advancements and uses in other aerospace applications.

Industrial

TCR prepreg materials continue their solid performance in all aspects of high and low pressure COPV applications, and a variety of structural applications for use in military armament; recreational goods; medical devices, with new automotive introductions.

Marine

TCR composite prepreg materials continue their long heritage for use in many aspects of the marine industry.

TCR Composites is a Worldwide Supplier
of Prepreg Composites Products

Products available in continuous tow/roving for filament winding, woven and stitched fabrics, braided sleeves, and unidirectional tapes. Resin content, resin flow during cure, and tack levels can be modified to suit process requirements. Distinguishing characteristics of TCR Prepregs include user-friendly processing and up to one-year shelf life at room temperatures (~24°C) without changes in material properties. Refrigerated shipping and storage are not required.

TCR Prepreg Technology has several advantages that set TCR Composites apart:
A unique family of thermoset epoxy prepreg resins
Room-temperature / Ambient storage
Shelf-life up to 12 months
200°F—350°F (93°C—177°C) Epoxy Systems
Resin content control to within ± 2% on towpreg, ± 3% on broadgoods
Efficient processability and high fiber performance
Controllable resin flow during cure
User-friendly and easy to handle
Flexible cure cycles; can be cured with or without pressure, in oven, press, or autoclave
Environmentally friendly, solvent-free process, and low VoC's
REACH & K-REACH Registration – EU, Korea

Prepregs Formulated for Your Success

-Manufacturer of Agricultural and Industrial Packaging-

FDS Manufacturing Company is a family owned company that started in 1950 and for over 70 years has grown into a major manufacturer of Industrial and Agricultural packaging on the West Coast. Headquartered in Pomona, California with a 240,000 square foot manufacturing and warehousing facility and an additional 110,000 square foot warehousing facility in Fowler California, FDS Manufacturing Company has thrived in both markets.

FDS Manufacturing Company produces high quality, eco-friendly standard and custom packaging for multiple industries ranging from food service, to cosmetics, to automotive.  In doing so, FDS Manufacturing Company has streamlined the processes to create these products so that they meet whatever your packaging need is. Currently, FDS uses extrusion, thermoforming, injection molding and unique paper converting processes to manufacture the products.  Click below to see all of our packaging offerings.

Clamshells

     FDS Manufacturing Company prides itself on making the very best agricultural packaging in the United States. With that in mind, FDS has created an entire line of clamshells to fit all the needs of the modern day packer. Our clamshell line ranges from 4.4 oz. to 4 lb. clamshells, in both Standard and Euro sizes. We use PET, which is 100% recyclable. Designed down to the last detail, the FDS Manufacturing clamshell is strong and reliable. We also have an extensive array of custom clamshells. Please send a request if you do not see what you are looking for. 

Fruit Trays

     Transporting fruit and vegetables is a science. There are many factors that influence whether or not the trip is successful. "turning", "bruising", and "vibration" are just a few of the risks produce face when going on a road trip. The FDS Manufacturing fruit trays are designed to hold the produce in place so that burning and bruising of the fruit are minimized. Not only are the FDS Manufacturing trays the best in protection, the trays are made from fully recyclable PET. The FDS Manufacturing trays are available in black, however other colors may be available so please contact us about what you're looking for.

Strawberry Baskets

      We have been injection molding Strawberry and Fruit Baskets since 1970. Our classic green Polypropylene (PP) baskets are the growers choice. Strawberries, Grape Tomatoes, and Cherry Tomatoes ship and store well in our baskets. Fruit baskets cool better than any other packaging available resulting in fresher fruit delivered from the grower to the customer.  Our high quality Polypropylene (PP) combined with meticulously maintained machinery result in superior quality baskets. Local manufacturing, multiple inventory locations, and our own fleet of trucks are what make our baskets the clear market leader. 

Food Service

     FDS Manufacturing introduces our new Food Service Packaging line. This line includes various sizes of Deli trays, Sandwich Containers, etc. All of our Food Service Packaging is made from 100% recyclable PET.

​

Single Face Corrugated

     Single face corrugated is a great packaging option and with so many sizes of rolls available, 3"-84" (custom sizing is also available); FDS Manufacturing Company has the solution for you. Our rolls are made with Kraft, bleached Kraft (white), or corrugated medium paper and feature several flute sizes (Jumbo Flute 7/16", A-Flute 3/16", B-flute 1/8", and E-Flute 1/16") to meet your packaging requirements.
FDS Manufacturing also has specialty coatings and options like: Seal Shield, a cohesive single face and HiFlex, a scored, highly flexible, single face. We also offer two-color printing on: the facing sheet, the corrugated side of the single face, or both sides.

Pizza Sheets

     There's nothing like opening a pizza box... and seeing a perfectly made pizza. Only to have the pie spoiled when you pick up the first slice and grease has soaked into the dough, making it soggy and unappetizing. 

That's where the F-D-S pizza sheet comes in:

-Made of B-Flute to raise the pizza above the box allowing for grease to drip away from the crust.

-Our pizza sheet is made with a FDA approved, bleached Kraft (white) paper.
-The F-D-S pizza sheet is constructed with an FDA approved, water resistant coating applied to the corrugated side of the sheet to aid in keeping the structural integrity of the pizza by wicking away the grease and condensation from the bottom of the food.

Angle Boards, Corner Boards and Frame Packs

     Furniture needs to be protected when it comes off an assembly line or when someone is moving from place to place. Angle pads are perfect for protecting the vulnerable legs and edges of furniture. When placed on an edge, the angle pad can absorb impact and provide scratch resistance, that will give you piece of mind when shipping furniture anywhere.

Mission
To provide our customers with quality products, fairly priced, in a timely manner.

Lefavor Envelope Company is a woman-owned business in operation since 1965. We have the latest envelope manufacturing and printing equipment that allows us to give you the best quality and versatility on your envelope needs.

We run in-line (flexo) printing, jet printing (litho quality) and multi-color printing with full coverage. We can cater to all types of envelope styles. We have the ability to run small 1,000 pc. orders to orders in the millions.

We specialize in custom sizes, custom windows, especially 9 x 12 and 10 x 13 with and without windows. View our Product List to see all the different envelopes that we manufacture and sell.

We have the capability of adding latex gumming or peel-n-seal to most envelope sizes.

WHEN IT NEEDS TO BE
DECORATED
Georgia-Pacific is one of the nation’s leading corrugated box manufacturers.

Understanding your needs and providing creative and custom solutions makes Georgia-Pacific much more than a typical corrugated packaging supplier and partner. Choose Corrugated to help formulate your plan, streamline your operations, eliminate waste, elevate your product and supply the right materials for the job.

Our customers can expect a teamwork approach, integrating materials, package engineering and automation elements that meet production, distribution and sales requirements.​ 

CORRUGATED
FACILITIES
Our packaging solutions meet you where you are

With a manufacturing network spanning the United States, our packaging solutions meet you where you are. Our corrugated operations are intentionally placed throughout the U.S. and Mexico to best serve our customers, while also being strategically located near Georgia-Pacific Containerboard mills. Our Georgia-Pacific Recycling team picks up post-consumer content, that is then sorted and returned to our containerboard mills for re-pulping. The recycled pulp-turned-paper is then brought back to Georgia-Pacific Corrugated facilities where it can serve another customer’s need – and the cycle continues.

WHEN IT NEEDS TO BE
TRUSTED
Positively impacting society and the communities in which we operate.
We care about the entire life cycle of our products – from ensuring the sustainability of our forests, responsibly manufacturing products, positively impacting society and the communities in which we operate, and having thoughtful solutions for the collection and reuse of corrugated packaging.
We practice sustainable forestry…

Cumberland Container

Cumberland Container can solve all your packaging and point-of-purchase display needs. Our proven track record and over 50 years of experience in providing quality products on time and per specifications ensures your container represents your best. From the design stage to delivery  of the final product, our team has the expertise and top-notch equipment to provide your packaging solutions.

 

Cumberland Container News
Machine Operator Spotlight - Gary Reagan

Gary Reagan has been with Cumberland Container for 28 years. He has been the machine operator for the Bobst Discovery since it was newly installed November 2022. The Discovery is a “set while run” machine, meaning we can change over from job to job quickly, averaging 8 minutes. So, we can mass produce with precision. Gary, and his crew are a great asset to this machine and we are so grateful to have them!

Read More...
Cumberland Adds Gazella Stitcher/Gluer

Cumberland Container is proud to introduce the cutting-edge Gazzella TO7200 2PC Stitcher/Gluer to our production line. This state-of-the-art machine offers unparalleled versatility, enabling us to efficiently Stitch, Hot Glue, Cold Glue, or perform the innovative Glitch operation (Stitch & Glue simultaneously) for 1 or 2-piece cartons in a single pass.

The Gazzella TO7200 is capable of joining cartons as small as 10"x3.5"x4" or 12"x2"x4", and as large as 129"x12"x86" or 78"x63"x86" with board grades E, B, C, or BC Flutes. This means we can cater to a wide array of packaging needs under one roof.

In May 2024, we will be installing the Gazzella TW7200, which can handle Triple Wall Cartons, expanding our capabilities even further.

Cumberland Container is committed to staying at the forefront of the packaging industry, continually expanding our capabilities to meet the evolving demands of our valued customers. Thank you for choosing us as your packaging partner!

Read More...
Driving Now.....On a Road Near You...

....Cumberland Container's new truck wrap.

Read More...
Land Acquired For Future Expansion

Jared Properties LLC has purchased 12.26 acres of land immediately adjacent to Cumberland Container’s main campus.  Jared Properties LLC shares ownership with Cumberland Container and the purchase is for Cumberland’s possible expansion at the appropriate time.  The new property and Cumberland’s current campus brings the total possible acreage to 27.12 acres. This new purchase ensures Cumberland Container is no longer landlocked and has more opportunities to grow its facilities.  This will aid Cumberland’s continued expansion and its ability to better serve our customers’ needs!

Read More...

OUR STORY

The Key Container Company is located in South Gate close to the heart of Los Angeles in a plant built in the 1920’s as a corrugated and solid fiber box manufacturer making it one of the oldest corrugated box facilities in the world.

Our mission is to service the Southern California industrial corrugated container user with some of the most advanced manufacturing technology available. Every one of our team is a trained professional from production to design, customer service, accounting, and sales. You won't find a more dedicated and knowledgeable organization in Los Angeles.

At Key Container Company we buy the linerboard and medium, corrugate it into a dimensionally correct sheet and turn that sheet into a finished box as efficiently as possible. Our commitment to service is legendary. Our 60-year history and experience is unequaled. No one is better equipped in Los Angeles to handle volume-corrugated production with an emphasis on service, quality, and design.

Please give us a call and let one of our sales staff examine your needs. Then come and visit our plant to see for yourself the huge capital investment in our factory and we are confident you will appreciate the fact that we mean business and will work hard to earn yours.

Thank you for your consideration.

Don't settle for generic packaging.

Standard Bag is a 2nd generation family run company headquartered in Oregon. We manufacture multiwall and wovenpoly laminated sacks for a diverse set of long-standing customers across multiple industries and markets. Our philosophy and success has been built on our speed, flexibility, and knowledge to help elevate our customers and their brands. Don’t settle for partners who seek to rely on generic solutions. Your problems are not generic, and neither should be your packaging.

Our Products

From industrials to food grade, we've got a bag that will suit your needs.

Wovenpoly

Our Products

Our tried and trued products are all custom manufactured to overdeliver on the expectations of our customers. From the proper bag size, to optimal film gauge or paper basis weight, to bulk density, we are devoted to ensuring that you have the right bag for your products.

Learn More
Our Capabilities

Our singular focus is to allow our customers to spend more time on growing their business instead of worrying about their packaging – ultimately, operating with less risk and less stress. Continual investment in our manufacturing equipment as well as a undying dedication to service runs deep in our company’s DNA.​

Learn More
Learn More
Our Markets

From our customers in the flour mills, to those in the dairy powder drying plants, to our friends producing animal feed, our sales and customer service teams are eager to provide packaging recommendations across a range of disciplines and industries.

Learn More
Our Company

Since 1985, our people have made the difference for our company and our customers. We are a family of bag makers who take pride in the products we manufacturer and the positive impact we can have in our customers' brands. 

Learn More
Food Safety & Certifications

All our plants are proud to be certified across the AIB, FSC, MBE, and PSSMA standards. We’re committed to providing continuous improvement in food safety managements systems to ensure confidence in the delivery of customers' brands  and products.

Corrosion Protection Packaging for Industry

Daubert Cromwell is a global manufacturer of Volatile Corrosion Inhibitor (VCI) protection for metals.

For more than 80 years, quality manufacturers have trusted Daubert Cromwell VCI products to protect their valuable metal parts against corrosion. Our VCI packaging papers, poly films, rust preventive liquids and emitters protect metals from corrosion during all stages of manufacture, storage and shipment all over the world. Through proven quality and years of exemplary service, the company has earned its reputation as "The leading name in corrosion prevention®."

How does VCI work?

VCI works by forming a protective molecular layer on the surface of metal, creating a barrier that prevents oxidation. Read more …

Daubert Cromwell VCI Products

Daubert Cromwell VCI products are used by customers in metal stamping and fabricating, heavy equipment, automotive, electronics, military, aerospace, and other industries where corrosion prevention is critical. Whether your parts need protection for days or years, we have a product to meet your needs.

Environmentally Friendly VCI

Clean, Effective, Environmentally Friendly VCI Solutions. Natural, bio-based VCI products that protect your metal parts and are safe for you and the environment.

View All Products
VCI Poly Films & Bags

Strong, flexible, water-resistant VCI films are available in sheeting, flat, recloseable, and gusseted bags, tubing, and custom sizes.

VCI Paper
VCI papers for protection of  ferrous, non-ferrous, and mulit-metal parts and components.

VCI Emitters
Devices that emit VCI compounds protect recessed areas within a package or enclosed space.

VCI Liquids & Rust Removers
Rust preventive liquids, oils, and coatings prevent rust on exposed metals and unpainted metal parts.

VERSIL-PAK™
Flexible, greaseproof, waterproof barrier material for protection of underground piping in corrosive or severe environments.



Daubert Cromwell specializes in volatile corrosion inhibitor (VCI) protection for metals.

Providing quality corrosion preventive products and services to meet the evolving needs of global customers.

About
Sorma USA
Over 40 Years

Sorma USA, part of the Sorma Group in Italy, is based in Visalia, CA, one of the most prominent agricultural regions in the world.

Established in the 1970’s, Sorma quickly became one of the world’s largest suppliers of “Turn Key” packaging and palletizing lines for the fresh produce industries. Because of its European roots, where high labor costs forced the industry to seek out automated technologies, Sorma was driven to be a key dynamic leader in the fruit and vegetable scene. Some of Sorma’s most renowned machines were designed in this era, including box palletizers, bin dumpers, and check weighers.

Ferguson Supply & Box Manufacturing Company

Ferguson Box has a combined 60 years of values and tradition with a commitment to packaging done right.

Since 1959, Ferguson Box has had a presence in the corrugated packaging business in the Southeast. We’ve served our customers and employees through growth in size as well as through expansion of services. With over 183,000 square feet of manufacturing space in southwest Charlotte, Ferguson Box offers state-of-the-art machinery and equipment along with graphic and structural expertise. Yet, we still retain our hardworking roots and accessibility to owners and management.

We’re following our founding beliefs of focusing on customers and employees and following good business sense to grow the business right. It’s working, and we’d like to tell you about it.

Topflight strives to be the first company customers think of when they have a need for unique, creative solutions requiring printing, die-cutting, and specialty converting.
Our Core Industries
Medical Devices

Topflight works with established medical companies and innovative startups to develop and manufacture components for the simplest to the most complex medical devices.

Renewable Energy

Topflight excels at label applications specifically for the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy marketplaces.

Tire & Automotive

Topflight has over 40 years of experience partnering with OEMs, Tier 2, and Tier 3 suppliers to make labels, overlays, sensors, printed electronics, and more for the tire & automotive industry.

Health & Beauty

Many of the top health and beauty companies you are familiar with come to Topflight for expertise and solutions for their cosmetic and personal care labeling and packaging needs.

Durable/Harsh Enviroments

Topflight produces many of the labels you see in your home every day. From power tools to appliances to fire extinguishers, we are equipped to produce any label designs requested.

Topflight Corporation has been providing innovative solutions to your toughest labeling and converting challenges since 1942.

Privately held and ISO 9001 and ISO 13485 certified, we take a collaborative approach to manufacturing labels, conductive parts, and die-cut components. As well as offering the most advanced digital printing, Topflight also has many conventional printing options with up to 12 print stations in line. Precision die and laser cutting, as well as complex multi-layer laminations, are also available for your most challenging converting applications.

About Us
Saica Pack in the USA
Careers
Newsroom

Creating new jobs, helping grow the economy and supporting new sustainable practices

Our Sustainable Journey
SAICA GROUP IN THE USA
Saica’ sustainable journey in the USA

For over seven decades, Saica Group has worked to revolutionize the packaging industry across Europe, providing innovative, high performance and environmentally sustainable solutions.

Our long history of success reflects our unique focus on the future, our ability to create opportunities for our employees and our customers, as well as our drive to continuously innovate new and better ways to improve efficiency and reduce the environmental impact of packaging and paper waste.

We are excited to announce that we are continuing this pursuit through an expansion into the US market with a new facility in Hamilton, Ohio.

With this new project, we’re not just building a new home for Saica Group, we’re becoming part of a new community, where we are actively creating new jobs, helping grow the economy and supporting new sustainable practices.

The start of a journey
Our journey in the United States will start with the building of our first factory: a corrugated packaging plant.
Ground-Breaking Event
On October 14, it will be date where the first stone of this new facility is put into place, indicating the beginning of our history in the American market.
Laying down the foundations
Saica Pack Hamilton keeps moving forward
ADDING VALUE TO THE AMERICAN MARKET

Investing in innovation

Saica Group is committed to innovation. We listen to our customers, understand their needs and provide high quality, efficient, innovative and environmentally friendly packaging solutions, thanks to our unique End-to-End solutions approach. We will invest nearly 72 million dollars in the creation of our 350,000-square-foot factory in Ohio. The construction will start in September 2020 and take eighteen months to finish.

Employment Creation

Are you looking for your next challenge? Our new state-of-the-art factory will entail workforce recruitment and training, helping grow the economy and supporting the local community. Initially, we will create sixty four new jobs: 27 skilled operators, 15 manufacturing, engineering and supply chain professionals, 13 sales staff and 9 office and management jobs.

One need. One solution

We provide a wide range of innovative solutions to help our customers respond to the new market demands through our sustainable packaging products. Our high performance packaging is specifically designed to fulfil the expectations of our customers and their end-users. It meets not only the technical standards required, but it is also appealing and attractive due to our high quality printing.

CONTACT US
Agile. Responsive. Experienced. Everything you need in a packaging partner.
Need a quick-turn delivery so you can hit your shipping deadline? We can do that.

What about cost-effective, custom packaging that will help you offer competitive product rates? Yeah, we can do that, too.

We are experts in optimizing design and materials in order to reduce your costs. With more than three decades in packaging design, we continually grow to develop more creative and cost-effective ways to keep our customers competitive with their packaging.

Our team is agile, designed to pivot and grow with you as you expand your product line and packaging needs. We can meet quick-turn deadlines for both large and small volume runs.

Want to learn more about the ProtectPac Advantage?

LEARN MORE
Customized packaging for even the most challenging products

Frustrated by having to work with 3 or more manufacturers to find one protective packaging solution for your product? We feel that. For years, companies have struggled with finding an all-in-one solution for packaging that deviates from the standard needs. Fortunately, we’re equipped to provide a consolidated customer experience to process your custom packaging needs all in one place.

Our custom packaging solutions will not only reduce your production time and costs, but you also benefit from standardized quality assurance that you can pass along to your customers.

Want to see if our customized solutions fit the bill?

OUR SOLUTIONS
Who We Serve
Every industry has specific packaging needs. Over the past several decades, we’ve streamlined our processes to help companies lower packaging costs and guarantee quality products are delivered to their customers. After all, your success is our success. We’re proud to partner with the following industries to meet standard and custom packaging needs.

OUR PRODUCTS
Effective packaging. Eco-Friendly process.

Packaging has historically been one of the largest culprits of environmental waste. We are changing that.

ProtectPac is focused on bringing packaging to the market through eco-friendly processes that consume fewer natural resources, such as water and energy. Our goal is to reduce environmental waste while still providing the quality of product that our customers (and their customers) have come to expect.

Learn more about our environmental responsibility here.
LEARN MORE
Reduce waste, not quality.
At ProtectPac, we take our impact on the environment seriously. We’ve devoted years to creating a sustainable packaging process that protects natural resources for future generations. Our waste reduction strategy focuses on minimizing energy use and landfill input, while increasing transportation efficiency.

We are proud to announce that we’ve introduced higher-yield materials into our production. This means our products are lighter to produce, transport and use, which equates to reduced energy use and greenhouse gas emissions.

PRESSURE SENSITIVE TAPE SOLUTIONS THAT STICK OUT FROM THE REST

At ABI and Ideal Tape, we produce an extensive line of pressure sensitive tapes to serve a wide variety of industries. Our custom tape products protect, splice, mask, insulate, transfer, reinforce, and seal challenges in many markets. Explore our offerings below.

AUTOMOTIVE

Avoid costly rework with our line of
protective interior and exterior automotive tapes, which can help prevent scratches and marring during automotive manufacturing, through to delivery to the dealer.

GRAPHICS

protecting digital prints, our family of
application and protective tapes has
something for everyone.

HVAC​

Our extensive line of aluminum foil and cloth tapes are used to seal metal and flexible ductwork in an array of challenging HVAC applications.

INDUSTRIAL

We offer the toughest industrial tapes
designed for the demanding applications
like high temperature masking, electrical
insulation, and splicing.

INSULATION

Our quality jacketing and cladding insulation
tapes are designed to stick to faced
insulation, with a variety of finishes to
match all of your applications.

SHOE & LEATHER GOODS

Shoes and leather goods like handbags,
watch bands, wallets, backpacks,
briefcases, safety footwear, and more can
be reinforced and supported with our line of
specialty tapes.

SURFACE PROTECTION

No matter the texture, we’ve got a
comprehensive line of protective paper and
film tapes designed to keep your surfaces
safe and clean through the manufacturing
process.

American Biltrite Inc., Manufacturing Solutions for over a Century

At ABI Tape Division, we produce adhesive coated, pressure sensitive tapes, films, and papers for all applications. We are a global team committed to creating the highest value for our customers with customized tape solutions.

As consumers, are we asking the right questions?

During our daily purchasing life, we need to think about the products we’re buying and ask ourselves: How did it get to the shelf? What did it do to the environment to get there? Where will it go when I’m done with it?

Compostables

In an active commercial compost, World Centric® products break down in 180 days.*

ABOUT COMPOSTABLES
Plastics & Styrofoams

Plastics and styrofoam products will never breakdown in our lifetime.

TAKE ACTION
A compendium of posts addressing social and sustainability issues, whether from a personal or global perspective.
ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES
Canada's Single-Use Plastics Ban

In October 2020, the Government of Canada released a Science assessment of plastic pollution, noting that plastic was polluting rivers, lakes and oceans as well as harming wildlife and generating microplastics in drinking water sources. Moving quickly, they then proposed a goal of zero plastic waste by 2030 and the Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) passed a federal single-use plastics ban to help achieve that goal.

READ ON EARTH MATTERS
COMPOSTING ISSUES
The Limits of Labeling Compostable Products

The compostables industry currently sees labeling as the most effective way of reducing contamination in the composting material stream. It is our position that labeling has been given an outsized role in many of the conversations about composting policy.

Paper With Purpose®

Boise Paper works tirelessly to engineer and deliver high quality products you can trust. When it comes to sustainability, we believe it’s our responsibility to give back in the most relevant and meaningful ways we can. From our commitment to U.S. manufacturing and responsible wood fiber sourcing, to supporting local schools and urban park transformations, we do more than make paper – we make a difference for your business, your community, and the future.

PAPER WITH PURPOSE

Environmental

Responsible interaction with natural biological systems to ensure our ecosystems endure for future generations.

Economic

Strategically optimizing assets and resources to provide long-term stability for communities on a local and global scale.

Social

Understanding how cultural, social, and physical needs interact, and encouraging people to engage in improving the places they live and work for the benefit of society.

Make Paper Work For You

Check out our PaperPulse blog for tips on making the most of your office life,
how to best use paper, and community events.

The Recycling Process: Paper vs. Plastic

While many people know the importance of recycling, fewer are familiar with the recycling process itself. Often, individuals toss their recyclables into the bin, assuming the materials undergo the same process once collected. However, once sorted, the process differs for materials such as paper and plastic so that they can be used again.

How to Overcome End-of-Year Burnout and Stay Focused

As the year winds down, many of us feel the weight of accumulated stress and fatigue, often referred to as “end-of-year burnout.” It’s a time when we juggle work deadlines, holiday preparations, and personal responsibilities.

America Recycles Day: Small Recycling Habits That Make a Big Difference

Recycling is one of the easiest and most impactful ways to protect the environment, and there’s no better time to start than on America Recycles Day (November 15).

The Role of Procurement in Promoting Sustainable Paper Practices

As businesses across industries commit to reducing their environmental footprint, procurement has emerged as a driver of sustainable practices, particularly in sourcing paper. With growing concerns about factors like deforestation and waste, procurement teams are adopting innovative approaches to ensure that the paper used by industries is produced and consumed responsibly.

How to Set Up your Desk for Maximum Productivity

Having an organized desk allows you to work with greater efficiency and focus. When items are neatly arranged and easily accessible, you won’t waste time hunting for them or wondering where they are.

How Paper Can Help You Build Stronger Customer Relationships

With emails, social media, and direct messaging dominating communication these days, it might seem counterintuitive to suggest that paper could play a significant role in building stronger customer relationships.

What We Do

Since 1904 Pilcher Hamilton Corporation has operated as one of the largest merchant suppliers and converters of polyester films in the USA, with a full range of value-added products & services.

Our breadth of PET films includes Anti-fog, Anti-static, Coated, Colored, Corona Treated, Clear High Barrier, Hazy, Heat sealable, High barrier, Metalized PET, PCR, Polymer pigmented, PvDC, Shrinkable, Soft Matte, Specialty Coated, Twistable, Tactical, and Ultra Clear and more Unique performance films.

Our services include slitting, die-cutting, printing and coating. Our strengths have been supreme quality, elevated service levels, creativity and expeditious delivery. PHC supplies industry converters that coat, laminate, print, and modify all grades of polyester film.

Our converting and warehousing facilities are uniquely located in Greer, SC with the ability to serve our customer base within 48 hours. PHC can inventory over 10,000,000 pounds of film enabling quick order fulfillment within 24 hours.

Our services include:

Printing

Winding

Sheeting

Die-Cutting

Corona Treating

Coating

Slitting

Toll Converting

Custom Services

Legacy of Excellence & Scope

Since 1904, Pilcher Hamilton Company has been at the forefront of industrial innovation, providing high-quality polyester film solutions to hundreds of industries. With over a century of expertise, we’ve built a Principled Hyper-focused Competitive PHC team legacy that combines tradition, wisdom, and service with cutting-edge technology.

TO THE NEW COMMERCIAL-WAGNER.COM!
Founded in 2007, Commercial-Wagner Inc. is the result of a merger between Wagner Brothers Containers, Inc.; founded in 1967 and Commercial Corrugated Inc. founded in 1976. The combined companies have over 70 years of success in the corrugated industry.

The company currently operates its manufacturing in a 120,000 sq. foot facility in Baltimore City and has a 55,000 sq. ft. facility for warehousing, distribution, and pack out services in Curtis Bay.

Commercial-Wagner operates as a sheet plant with 17 different box making machines. Our product mix includes standard brown and white boxes, die cuts, both rotary and flatbed, extra-large boxes, taped, glued, and stitched. We also provide hand assembly, fulfillment and high-end graphics.

Commercial-Wagner serves all of Maryland, Delaware, Southern Pennsylvania, and Northern Virginia through our own fleet of trucks.

PSI INTRODUCTION

Packaging Services Industries, Inc. (PSI) began as a small family operation, but it has since grown to 3 locations, 300 employees, and thousands of overjoyed customers. As a dominant force in the corrugated box marketplace for the Mid-Atlantic region, PSI credits its success to product innovation, exceptional customer service, product quality, state of the art equipment, involved employees and on-time delivery capabilities.

PSI has uniquely positioned itself for the 21st century. The company employs approximately 400 skilled workers with each providing a quality product and a high level of service. Over 2,000 customers, ranging from companies achieving $1 billion in annual sales to small, family-owned enterprises utilize PSI’s design capabilities, state-of-the-art box-making equipment, and quick order turnaround.

In a highly competitive market, PSI’s total annual sales have increased 5-10% per year since 1990. PSI strives to better serve our customers and supply an ever-growing base of customers with a broad range of products and services. Products include corrugated packaging, foam packaging, packaging supplies, as well as glass cutting and packaging.

©Lohmann GmbH & Co.KG
Innovative Klebetechnik für Ihre Branche
Lohmann ist Ihr zuverlässiger Partner für industrielle Klebelösungen - von der Produktentwicklung über Hightech-Converting bis zur Prozessintegration

Die Vorteile der Klebetechnik sind offenkundig: leicht, sauber und vor allem sicher. Ob Automobilindustrie, Bauwesen, Druckindustrie oder Medizintechnik - die Anwendungsfelder der zukunftsweisenden Lohmann-Technologien sind vielfältig. Sie sorgen beispielsweise für sicheren Halt von Anbauteilen an Autos, effiziente Fertigungsprozesse in der Elektronikindustrie, einfache Repositionierbarkeit bei der Klischeemontage im Flexodruck oder hautfreundliche Healthpatches für medizinische Diagnostik - die kreativen Innovationen der Klebetechnik-Experten reichen von multifunktionalen Klebebandportfolios für das elektrische und thermische Management in EV-Batterien bis hin zu kundenindividuellen Stanzteilen in geringen µm-Toleranzen, die mittels Pick-and-Place Technologie in der Serienfertigung appliziert werden.

Dabei setzen wir seit über 170 Jahren auf Spitzentechnologie und Präzision in der industriellen Klebetechnik. Wir bieten maßgeschneiderte Lösungen mit doppelseitigen Klebebändern, Transfer-Filmen und reaktiven Klebstoffsystemen, die bereits in zahlreichen Branchen weltweit Standard sind. Wir verbinden Komponenten effizient und sicher, um optimale Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu ermöglichen. Von der weltweiten Spezifikationsarbeit über die individuelle Produktentwicklung und Inhouse-Converting mit verschiedenen hochpräzisen Fertigungsverfahren bis hin zur Integration in Ihre Produktionsprozesse - unsere Experten begleiten Sie während des gesamten Projektes.

Im Fokus unseres Familienunternehmens stehen bei der Produktentwicklung stets Nachhaltigkeit und schonender Ressourceneinsatz. Lösemittelfreie Fertigung, UV-Härtung statt energieintensiven Wärmeprozessen oder Recyclingkonzepte sind nur einige der innovativen Ansätze von Lohmann.

Beispiele sind u.a. die smarte TwinMelt® Technologie, die zum einen innovative Klebebandlösungen ermöglicht und zum anderen auf Lösemittel bei der Beschichtung doppelseitiger Klebebänder verzichtet und somit den CO2-Fußabdruck des Unternehmens signifikant reduziert. Ein weiteres Beispiel ist die Entwicklung der Klebetechnologie UV-LUX®. Sie ist die weltweit erste durch UV-Licht aktivierte Klebebandlösung mit Farbumschlag und ermöglicht Kunden so auf das energieaufwendige Warmhärten zu verzichten. Auch die biobasierten Klebebänder der DuploCOLL® ECO-Reihe und das LinerLoop-Konzept, das einen geschlossenen Recycling-Kreislauf für Papierliner ermöglicht, belegen die Vereinbarkeit von Innovation und Nachhaltigkeit.

Bereits 1851 gegründet, gilt Lohmann als Pionier der Klebeband-Technologie und ist heute weltweit tätig. Die Zentrale der Klebebandgruppe befindet sich in Neuwied/Deutschland. Das Unternehmen beschäftigt weltweit ca. 1.800 Mitarbeiter und ist an 27 internationalen Standorten sowie mit exklusiven Vertriebspartnern rund um den Globus aktiv.

4. Dez 2024
Mehr als Compliance: Lohmann auf dem ESG-Symposium in Köln
Im November nahm Katharina Candia Avendaño, Global Head of Sustainability bei Lohmann, als Hauptrednerin am ESG-Symposium in Köln teil. Das von CINTONA organisierte Event brachte ESG-Manager, Strategen, Analysten, Controller und Regulierungsbehörden zusammen, um sich mit dem kritischen Bereich der ESG-Anforderungen (Umwelt, Soziales und Unternehmensführung) und ihren tiefgreifenden Auswirkungen auf Strategie, Geschäftspraktiken und Finanzierung auseinanderzusetzen. Hier weiterlesen

Welcome to Grand Traverse Container
Corrugated Boxes, Packaging Solutions, and More

Grand Traverse Container has been manufacturing custom corrugated packaging since 1995. Over the years, our reliable service and prompt delivery to our customers has allowed us to grow to more than 100 employees.

We are responsive to the needs of our customers. The experts here have an extraordinary level of integrity. They enjoy what they do and thrive in a corporate culture that allows them to take action. Our innovative ideas make the entire process smooth and reduce costs for our clients.

We are proud to serve all of Michigan northern Ohio, and northern Indiana. Our 90,000 square feet of manufacturing space in Traverse City is complimented by an additional 90,000 square feet in our Grand Rapids location. We have manufacturing facilities in both our Traverse City and Grand Rapids locations.

Our company-owned-and-operated fleet means we can go in any direction!

If you’d like to come and see us, please call to schedule a tour of our facilities in Traverse City or Grand Rapids.

Corporate Culture

Our employees share a vision that starts at the top. We create partnerships with our clients. What we do cannot be described as merely a vendor/supplier relationship.

Every employee is part of a team inspired to make a product that makes them proud — and customers happy.

If you’re looking for a partner with a strong foundation, creative ideas and the ability to respond, you just found it.

Who We Are

Elliott Group International is a leading tape supplier in the automotive industry with a commitment to product knowledge, customer service and a determination to provide quality products and solutions. EGI / Elliott Tape was incorporated in 1974 to serve the automotive industry and expanded its business to include Automotive, Appliance, Aerospace, Military, Industrial and Specialty industries. As a global supplier corporation, currently shipping to over 20 countries, we have sales and distribution locations in Auburn Hills, MI and El Paso, TX and a sales office in Singapore. In addition, the Elliott Tape portion of our organization is proud to be recognized as a certified Veteran Owned Business.  

Our wide selection of products include pressure sensitive tapes, foil products, polyester and fleece, masking tapes, cloth tapes, foam products, surface protection, heat shrink tubing and many products for custom applications.

Crockett Graphics DBA


We are the West Coast's premier supplier of folding cartons, corrugated boxes and packaged good. Gared serves the medical instrument, pharmaceutical/neutrceutical, food service and retail display markets with unbeatable pricing and quick turn-around. 





Our plants in Camarillo and Los Angeles have state of the art sheet fed litho presses as well as high speed roll fed flexo presses with exceptional graphic capabilities. We do all of our pre-press in house as well as make all of our own inks, printing plates and cutting dies for maximum quality control and the shortest lead times. Gared also has all of it's own finishing equipment  in house including: Film Windowing, UV Coating, Foil Stamping/Embossing, Tapered Food Tray Gluers and much more.





Gared Graphics strives to use the most sustainable substrates possible in the manufacture of our cartons. We carry AIB Certification. We start with the smallest "Footprint" in mind during design and follow that through with environmentally safe board and inks during production.

PP Bags Manufacturers

Consumer Packaging

Coated Fabrics

A FULL SPECTRUM OF BRAND-ENHANCING SOLUTIONS

Packaging. Print. Fulfillment.

Every day at Spectrum Packaging Corporation we hold true to our brand philosophy: “thINK Different.” Our clients see it in our communication, our creativity, and in their final product.

From packaging to printing, and just about everything in between, you’ll see that our team isn’t just hitting buttons on machines—they’re understanding your needs from all angles, paying attention to the details, and offering new ideas so that you get the most out of what we’re building for your brand. For more than two decades, we’ve been mastering our craft and building lasting relationships with clients. Let us show you what it means to “thINK Different” about packaging and printing.

SPC is an expert in COVID packaging for home test kits and face shields. Learn more.

TALK TO A PRINT AND PACKAGING EXPERT
Quality. Craftsmanship.
INNOVATION
THE PERFECT PACKAGE AT THE PERFECT SIZE

Whether your carton or run size is big or small, our process is flexible and nimble enough to cater to each client’s needs, no matter their size. This allows us to provide better service and more relational thinking than other facilities of considerable volume. Pair that with some of the brightest people in the business and the most advanced machinery in the South, and you’ve got a front row seat to innovative ideas with bigger impact.

Contact us today to learn more about our packaging and printing solutions.

Welcome to Hunter Panels and Hunter Xci! Since 1997 Hunter Panels has been the leader in thermal efficient polyiso insulation with the addition of Hunter Xci for wall applications in 2012. With eight plants spanning across the United States, Hunter Panels has all you need for roof and wall polyiso insulation. Hunter products contain no HFCs, CFCs, or HCFCs and are made using recycled materials. Products help reduce a building’s carbon footprint and have virtually no global warming potential and have zero ozone-depleting potential. LEED credits can be given by utilizing Hunter products in the areas of optimizing energy performance, thermal comfort, building life-cycle impact reduction, and more.

Established in 1958, Harmsco Filtration Products has manufactured innovative and cost-effective solutions for liquid filtration challenges. PFOS Contaminant Removal
Commercial and Industrial

With flow rates up to 2,400 gpm. Harmsco's Green Products save energy, conserve process fluids and reduce operating costs. Standard features include NSF listing, Electropolished 304/316 Stainless Steel, specialty coatings and industry leading cost per gallon filtered.

Pool and Spa

Increase the performance and energy efficiency of your swimming pool or spa with Harmsco pleated anti-microbial cartridges and innovative filter housing technology. Operating costs are lower as no water or chemicals are lost due to backwashing.

Municipal

Why Protect-all?

Innovation, R&D, and customer commitment. Supplying premium quality flexible packaging and thermal laminating films to the converting and graphic arts industries for over 22 years.

Commitment to Quality

Protect-all is committed to providing quality products and services to our customers, with a strong emphasis on document control, traceability, and food safety.

Proudly Made in the USA Since 1990

Known as an innovator since our inception, we welcome new challenges that keep our customer and us on the cutting edge of the packaging and laminating industries.

Manufacturing High-Quality Standard and Custom Laminating Films

Servicing the laminating and print finishing industry for more than 22 years with standard and custom films, including many new products developed from listening to our customers!

First Class R&D and New Product Development

Whether you need a competitive film sample analyzed, or simply have technical or process questions, you can rely on Protect-all's R&D and technical experience for help.

Why Protect-all?

Innovation, R&D, and customer commitment. Supplying premium quality flexible packaging and thermal laminating films to the converting and graphic arts industries for over 22 years.

0
1

Welcome to Protect-all

Protect-all is a world-class manufacturer of premium quality films for both flexible packaging and thermal laminating applications. Our packaging films cover a wide variety of products including lidding films, cheese sealant, light and heavy-gauge prelams, barrier webs, numerous Cosmetic web films, forming and non-forming structures, as well as industrial and specialty films.

Protect-all’s laminating films include standard and premium clarity films as well as specialty and custom lamination products. Our films are specifically designed to provide protection and enhancement to printed and other manufactured products. Some specialty products include high clarity films, curl resistant films, printable/glueable clear, metalized and holographic products, colored films and a variety of textured films. With more than 110,000 square feet of manufacturing and warehouse space, we are also able to offer converting services for our customers including toll-coating, corona treating, slitting, sheeting, gravure coatings and solventless adhesive laminations.

At Protect-all, our technical support team and product development specialists are second-to-none. We offer consultation at no charge on many packaging and laminating applications, and have helped our customers develop solutions to some of their most difficult film challenges. Whether you are looking for standard packaging or laminating films, specialty products, converting services or innovative laminating solutions for a new project or idea, Protect-all is your one-stop source to meet all of your packaging and laminating film needs.

SCIENCE.   SERVICE.
STRAINRITE
	
Over 40 Years of Excellence & Expertise
For over 40 years, The Strainrite Companies has designed and manufactured an extensive selection of top-quality liquid filtration products, becoming an industry leader with a global presence. Incorporated in 1978, the family-owned company has grown and flourished: with customers throughout the U.S., Europe, and Asia, Strainrite’s worldwide reach continues to broaden.
 
Strainrite’s filtration products are used to ensure final fluid product quality, protect equipment, and improve process yields in just about every industry: paints, coatings, inks, beverages, biopharmaceuticals, electronics and more. Strainrite’s success can be attributed to an unwavering commitment to innovation, paired with expertise in high-quality, timely manufacturing. We manufacture in silicone free,  ISO9001 accredited facilities, and many of our products are manufactured for use in accordance with GMP.
 
Strainrite’s success can be attributed to an unwavering commitment to innovation, paired with a consultative selling approach which offers a holistic solution to each client’s unique needs. Experienced field sales professionals and distributors provide a comprehensive needs assessment, outlining which Strainrite product, service, or combination will best suit the client’s needs. New product innovations are derived from a collaborative philosophy where new products are developed through customer-supplier communication and cooperation. This method facilitates long-term, strategic relationships with clients in a wide range of industries.
Offering an unmatched combination of capabilities, certifications, and approvals in industries including automotive, paints, coatings, adhesives, plating, inks and chemicals, Strainrite has the experience to provide custom solutions for even the most difficult and critical filtration challenges. Ready to find the ideal filter for your unique application? Request a quote today!
Filter
​Bags
Strainrite offers liquid filter bags for a wide range of industry. The heritage of The Strainrite Companies is closely tied to the initial development of Filter Bag Technology. Our Founder, John H. Lapoint Jr., was an integral part of the team that conceived of, perfected, and proliferated, the original Filter bag. The Strainrite companies strives to apply the filtration expertise we’ve gained in over 30 years of partnership with of our customers, along with the innovation we’ve become known for, to manufacture classic, top quality, filter bags.
	
Vessels
​& Housing
There are several configurations of standard and custom fitted filter bag and cartridge housings available from Strainrite, including Manifold Bag Housing Systems, Single Bag Housings, and Multi Bag Housings. Available in sizes styles to fit many filtration applications, housings by Strainrite are an integral addition to any existing filtration system. From low flow SRL vessels that come with loads of extra features the competitors’ lack, to industrial grade SRID vessels that offer the most advanced filtration technology available, The Strainrite Companies offer a comprehensive suite of modifications and integrated add-ons.
	
Clarity
​Cartridges
Strainrite liquid filter cartridges are used for the clear filtration of liquids, whether it be for sterilization or to separate micro-organisms. Our proprietary liquid filter cartridges come in three different styles: Membrane Cartridge Filters, Pleated Depth Cartridge Filters and Large Diameter Pleated Cartridge Filters. A variety of filter media and types are available and specialized for whatever your project may be. Filter cartridges are designed to have a continuous and repeatable effluent quality. Strainrite delivers filter media that offers uniform consistency as they work to separate out particles from the liquid for an effective sterilization.

	
Madd Maxx: Large Diameter Hybrids
MADD-MAXX filters are engineered for critical high purity applications, optimizing thoughput while maintaining an absolute rated performance that is consistent and reliable. 
These hybrid elements combine the advantages of typical bag filtration, ease of use, and exceptional dirt holding capacity with the high efficiency and performance of cartridge filtration. Inside-out flow design ensures that unwanted contaminates stay inside the element during change out, virtually eliminating the possibility of downstream contamination.

Gabriel Container Co. Expert package designing to your specification

Gabriel Container Co. is the only independent and integrated manufacturer of corrugated shipping boxes and paper on the West Coast.

Gabriel Container Co. has been a family owned manufacturer of corrugated shipping boxes since 1939. What makes us special is that we are an integrated manufacturer, from raw material to finished product at one facility. We handle large scale recycling of OCC (old corrugated containers) in our Recycle Waste Products division. Once the OCC has been processed into pulp the liquid is pumped into our mill, Specialty Paper Mills. Once the pulp is processed through our mill, the result is giant rolls of paper. Those giant rolls of paper are then taken to our warehouse to be run through our corrugator. We have state of the art machinery. We can manufacture a box any size to fulfill our client’s specifications.

Trusted Box Manufacturer with Over 50 Years of Excellence in Custom Packaging and Digital Print Solutions

Jamil Packaging is a family-owned and operated corrugated box company with over five decades of experience crafting innovative and high-quality packaging solutions, from basic shipping boxes to complex, high-graphic designs.

Our headquarters in Mishawaka, IN, spans 175,000 square feet and features state-of-the-art machinery, CAD systems, and cutting-edge manufacturing technology, with a 250-mile service radius from our location. Complemented by our facility in Gallatin, TN, we ensure efficient production and delivery across the eastern south-central region.

Our commitment to sustainability is reflected in our use of SFI and FSC-certified materials and responsible waste management practices. Utilizing advanced technology, we prioritize speed and efficiency to get your products packaged and shipped quickly, all while exceeding your expectations for quality, pricing, and customer service.

Engineered multi material solutions

Packaging Solutions
Multimaterial Solutions

Our engineers work closely with our customers to develop a suitable packaging solution for their specific product. With our in-house testing capabilities, we are also able to test and validate the design to ensure that the packaging protects the content for the entire journey.

FIBER

Fiber based solutions is available all over the world. It can be customized to engineer mono-material solutions that are easily recycled in the paper stream or used in combination with other materials.

Low-cost and easy to use
PLYWOOD

Our plywood solutions are strong, nail-free for a safer, and offer a great printing area, giving customers a chance to make their brand stand out. Plywood is compliant from an IPPC perspective due to its thin veneers and therefore works great for export shipments.

Save money through the supply chain
WOOD

Wood is used for outer packaging solutions, pallets and heavy skids. Using those as a baseline, it is possible to design a wide variety of packaging. All our wood-based solutions are ISPM 15 compliant and can be used as export packaging.

ISPM 15 Compliant
PLASTIC

From standard foldable large containers (FLCs) to customized solutions made of multiwall plastic sheets, and injection-molded or vacuum-formed trays.
